verbose_text: It has been also listed that nuclear actin controls the transcription of its target genes through different mechanisms : i) specifically binding to a 27-nt repeat element in intron 4 of the endothelial nitric oxide synthase gene and regulating its expression; ii) participation in chromatin remodeling necessary for gene activation; iii) direct role in RNA transcription by being part of the pre - initiation complex with RNA polymerase II; or iv) participation in transcriptional elongation.
